result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 9:37 Defendant Erin K Casperson in court with attorney Jessica Shank Phelps.  Defendant Erin K Casperson in custody.  Sarah Kenas appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Dismissed and read-in to 15CM753.

2:28 Defendant Erin K Casperson in court with attorney Jessica Shank Phelps.  Defendant Erin K Casperson in custody.  Sarah Kenas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Phelps moves the court to modify bond to a signature bond.  State argues that Casperson will not honor any bond and opposes the motion.  Atty Phelps presents further argument.  Court denies the motion to modify bond.

ADDRESS INFO for Erin K Casperson

Prior: 1011 S Cherry Ave, Marshfield, WI 54449
Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of Bond
Includes 15CM756 & 15CM753. Absolute sobriety.   Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol. No contact with A.S.

2:57 Defendant Erin K Casperson in court with attorney David R. Dickmann.  Defendant Erin K Casperson in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.
